article.title: NetBSD 3.0 Installation Quick and Clean
article.subtitle: This document is aimed at gathering the best way to properly install NetBSD 3.0 on your machine, as quick as possible, with 3 sample configurations : server, desktop, development workstation

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para: For the following, I assume that you have a broadband connection, so you are able to download easily the needed files.
I also assume that you have a basic knowledge of BSD systems, and I pass some details. If something is unclear for you can refer to the NetBSD Guide which explains all the details you might need.
However I will try to include as much details as possible so even "BSD-dummies" can install NetBSD.
If there is any problem or you are not sure of what to do, just read the NetBSD Guide.
If something is wrong in here, or if it needs to be improved, just send me a mail.

section.title: SysInst
section.para: The root is big enough with 256MB as nothing big gets written in it except the kernels which are usually less than 8MB.

I personaly advise for a /var of 2GB size at least if you dont want to bother to much after installation about it. Many things get written in there by default. (logs, mails, pkg database, temp uncompress, etc.)
The default for /tmp should be enough.
Balance the remaining space between /usr and /home, depending of the number of user (/home bigger) and software installed (/usr bigger)
Then you might want to add softdep on FFSv1 for /usr, and /home (not safe enough for /root and /var in my own opinion...)
